iterate.get_nth¶

abjad.tools.iterate.get_nth(expr, klasses, n=0)¶

New in version 1.1.1.

Todo

combine with find().

Return element n in the klasses of expr.

abjad> staff = Staff([ ])
abjad> durations = [Rational(n, 16) for n in range(1, 5)]
abjad> notes = construct.notes([0, 2, 4, 5], durations)
abjad> rests = construct.rests(durations)
abjad> leaves = listtools.interlace(notes, rests)
abjad> staff.extend(leaves)

abjad> print staff.format
\new Staff {
        c'16
        r16
        d'8
        r8
        e'8.
        r8.
        f'4
        r4
}
abjad> for n in range(4):
...      iterate.get_nth(staff, Note, n)
...
Note(c', 16)
Note(d', 8)
Note(e', 8.)
Note(f', 4)
abjad> for n in range(4):
...      iterate.get_nth(staff, Rest, n)
...
Rest(16)
Rest(8)
Rest(8.)
Rest(4)
abjad> iterate.get_nth(staff, Staff)
Staff{8}

Read backwards for negative values of n.

abjad> for n in range(3, -1, -1):
...      iterate.get_nth(staff, Rest, n)
...
Rest(4)
Rest(8.)
Rest(8)
Rest(16)

Note

Because this function returns as soon as it finds instance n of klasses, it is more efficient to call iterate.get_nth(expr, _Leaf, 0) than expr.leaves[0]. It is likewise more efficient to call iterate.get_nth(expr, _Leaf, -1) than expr.leaves[-1].

iterate.depth_first

iterate.grace
